algorithm.name: Insertion sort
algorithm.description: An in-place, stable sorting algorithm that sorts the array one item at a time. The algorithm in quadratic in the worst case and therefore inefficient for large data sets however, the algorithm is quite efficient for small data sets, much like other quadratic sorting algorithms. Moreover the algorithm is efficient for sorted or partially sorted data sets, for already sorted data sets the runtime is O(n) and is also the best case, when each element in the array is no more than k places away from its sorted position the runtime can be bounded by O(k*n).
algorithm.complexity: O(n^2), n - size of the array
